intro: Andryala denudata, commonly known as the naked andryala, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its botanical features include a slender stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a distinct umbel of flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
